speaker: BENEDICK
text: Lady Beatrice, have you wept all this while?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Yea, and I will weep a while longer.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I will not desire that.

text: You have no reason. I do it freely.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Surely I do believe your fair cousin is

speaker: BENEDICK
text: wronged.

text: Ah, how much might the man deserve of me

speaker: BEATRICE
text: that would right her!

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Is there any way to show such friendship?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: A very even way, but no such friend.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: May a man do it?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: It is a man’s office, but not yours.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I do love nothing in the world so well as

speaker: BENEDICK
text: you. Is not that strange?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: As strange as the thing I know not. It were as

speaker: BEATRICE
text: possible for me to say I loved nothing so well as you,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: but believe me not, and yet I lie not; I confess

speaker: BEATRICE
text: nothing, nor I deny nothing. I am sorry for my

speaker: BEATRICE
text: cousin.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: By my sword, Beatrice, thou lovest me!

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Do not swear and eat it.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I will swear by it that you love me, and I will

speaker: BENEDICK
text: make him eat it that says I love not you.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Will you not eat your word?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: With no sauce that can be devised to it. I

speaker: BENEDICK
text: protest I love thee.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Why then, God forgive me.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: What offense, sweet Beatrice?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: You have stayed me in a happy hour. I was

speaker: BEATRICE
text: about to protest I loved you.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: And do it with all thy heart.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I love you with so much of my heart that

speaker: BEATRICE
text: none is left to protest.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Come, bid me do anything for thee.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Kill Claudio.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Ha! Not for the wide world.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: You kill me to deny it. Farewell.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Tarry, sweet Beatrice.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I am gone, though I am here. There is no

speaker: BEATRICE
text: love in you. Nay, I pray you let me go.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Beatrice—

speaker: BEATRICE
text: In faith, I will go.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: We’ll be friends first.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: You dare easier be friends with me than

speaker: BEATRICE
text: fight with mine enemy.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Is Claudio thine enemy?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Is he not approved in the height a villain

speaker: BEATRICE
text: that hath slandered, scorned, dishonored my kinswoman?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: O, that I were a man! What, bear her in

speaker: BEATRICE
text: hand until they come to take hands, and then, with

speaker: BEATRICE
text: public accusation, uncovered slander, unmitigated

speaker: BEATRICE
text: rancor—O God, that I were a man! I would eat his

speaker: BEATRICE
text: heart in the marketplace.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Hear me, Beatrice—

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Talk with a man out at a window! A proper

speaker: BEATRICE
text: saying.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Nay, but Beatrice—

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Sweet Hero, she is wronged, she is slandered,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: she is undone.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Beat—

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Princes and counties! Surely a princely testimony,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: a goodly count, Count Comfect, a sweet

speaker: BEATRICE
text: gallant, surely! O, that I were a man for his sake! Or

speaker: BEATRICE
text: that I had any friend would be a man for my sake!

speaker: BEATRICE
text: But manhood is melted into curtsies, valor into

speaker: BEATRICE
text: compliment, and men are only turned into tongue,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: and trim ones, too. He is now as valiant as Hercules

speaker: BEATRICE
text: that only tells a lie and swears it. I cannot be a man

speaker: BEATRICE
text: with wishing; therefore I will die a woman with

speaker: BEATRICE
text: grieving.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Tarry, good Beatrice. By this hand, I love

speaker: BENEDICK
text: thee.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Use it for my love some other way than

speaker: BEATRICE
text: swearing by it.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Think you in your soul the Count Claudio

speaker: BENEDICK
text: hath wronged Hero?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Yea, as sure as I have a thought or a soul.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Enough, I am engaged. I will challenge

speaker: BENEDICK
text: him. I will kiss your hand, and so I leave you. By

speaker: BENEDICK
text: this hand, Claudio shall render me a dear account.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: As you hear of me, so think of me. Go comfort your

speaker: BENEDICK
text: cousin. I must say she is dead, and so farewell.
